column4: tomslominski there is a program you can installed called Boot-Up Manger that will let you pick which programs you want to start when you turn on your computer
tomslominski what
cheers, I'll have a look
tomslominski what command were you using on RedHat systems to do this?
I can't remember, I'd have to have a look if you really want to know
if it wouldn't take you to long I would really like to know or if you can give me some more info I might be able to find it myself
Is there an IRC client or a plug in for an IRC client that will wake a computer display/monitor/screen when it receives a new message?
chkconfig
thank you!
i just found it in the repo
i was sure someone told me its RPM/RedHat only!
yeah me to
on RedHat it's different, it's a curses ui.
maybe it doesn't work the same on Debian based systems
So on RHEL or Fedora it works like Midnight Commander?
yes, something like that.
its pretty cool
I'm going to look into get chkconfig to work the same on Ubuntu as it does on RHEL I'll tell you if I get anywhere
cool, cheers for that
rcconf is supposed to be Ubuntu equivalent to RHEL's chkconfig
that's it! thanks!
Yeah I just installed rcconf and it looks like a great tool for a server or another environment where you can use a GUI
Ubuntu also has  sysv-rc-conf but it is not supported by Canonical like rcconf is and I haven't tried sysv-rc-conf
